channel.title: What Should I do?
channel.description:
Well since MOST of you mscpers are all like over 18 (the more professional ones) So, here's the case. I REALLY like this girl, a Crush I liked her since I started highschool and I am a sophomore now She Is really really quiet, She won't talk to anybody not girl nor boy It's killing Me, Does anyone have suggestions? I am not used to public speaking and especially talking to girls.
Inb4thetrolls

item.title: What Should I do?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:1, topic:429134”]Well since MOST of you mscpers are all like over 18 (the more professional ones)
So, here’s the case. I REALLY like this girl, a Crush I liked her since I started highschool and I am a sophomore now
She Is really really quiet, She won’t talk to anybody not girl nor boy
It’s killing Me, Does anyone have suggestions?
I am not used to public speaking and especially talking to girls.

Inb4thetrolls[/quote]
There aren’t many ‘moparscapers’ over 18; mitbers, yes. I laughed at ‘professional’. Just talk to her like a normal human being, you’re of the same age/location/school or around it so surely you two must have SOME common ground.

Read full topic

item.title: What Should I do?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Tree:

I do professional coaching little girl. I’m payed for it.

Evidently your pay is not high enough to cover spell check expenses

PS. While we’re on this topic, I once had a chance at having a relationship with a girl. I messed it up royally though, but now when I look back I realise that she isn’t really the best match for me. What I think is, the emotions I used to feel were just related to this being my first relationship, nothing else.

item.title: What Should I do?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

fuck her she’s not noticed you yet, i have do me!

But anyways… I used to really like this girl who is also shy and quiet(probably not as quiet as the girl you like), trust me I adored her ;o.
Basically, what I did cause at the time I was in High School and she was in her girlygroup at that time not friends with my friends so I basically as soon as I saw her talking to someone I knew I went over joined in the conversation made her laugh a bit then jokely teased and then I basically became friends with her little group as trust mee girls listen to there friends if your not there number one and if your just getting to know her your not her number one yet. So after that luckily we connected our personalities wise and the kaboomski we was going out:D.
See if she doesn’t really talk to people if somehow just get her talking just that little bit to you by talking about her interests and showing a keen interest in her(not too keen unless she likes you ofc) then she’ll just latch onto you and it shouldn’t be too hard as long as theres Chemistry between yous however do you really want to go out with a person based on just there looks? Cause if she really is that shy and quiet she might naturally be like that and that might not be a fit for you and remember you shouldn’t have to do all the work, going out with someone is two way feelings if your putting in all the effort she doesn’t deserve you :o.

If it doesn’t work out, i’m always here for chuu <3

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

Nathan R:

Is she in any of your classes?

All of them except Spanish and English

Tree and Amy got me brain dead in an huge debate

I swear in every thread there is a pattern

Agreement
Quote agreement
Opinion
Opinion
Troll
Trolls back
Stays back on topic
Disagreement
Argue
Disagree
Argue
Argue
Says this ends
Then troll for 3 or more posts
Stays on topic
Disagreement comes back
Ot:
But I just cant look her in the eye, I really want her but something is always stopping me
I really hate that feeling
I am really nervous around girls especially around her
I would do anything to get close to her
I swear this feeling is unbearable
Anythinggg

All tested? Then why are they wrong? You assume mine are wrong because of your experiences and same with me, i don't understand why you're getting mad when all teenage girls react differently to different situations. It isn't some kind of predictable situation, shes going to do whatever she sees fit.
I did win. Around 4 posts ago. Yet you fail to accept it. It's my pleasure to drum it into you. Fuckwit.

can I get into your pants plzplzplz? [/quote[ Lateerrrr, I'm tiirrreeeeddddd.

Good day.

item.title: What Should I do?
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:49, topic:429134”][quote]
I’m rather experienced with the opposite sex actually. You’re also not the only one who’s spoken to people in these situations? What a poor argument to throw at me. I’ve also coached plenty of guys in these situations. Majority of them have been successful.
[/quote]
As have i, in multipul guy situations one even including a girl at one point. All successful.

Like i said above (i’ve repeated this line a thousand times, because you must have selective reading or something), I agree she wouldn’t ‘open up’ immediately on an emotional level. However, she would enjoy talking about herself if the approach is handled correctly.

I’m saying even if approched correctly she still wouldn’t talk about herself, waht aren’t you understanding?

I swear i just covered that. I’ve stuck to my points throughout this debate. Yet yours have shifted every two seconds. You’re trying to go against my posts just so you don’t seem less intelligent. It’s having the opposite effect.

If you assume you’ve already won this debate why don’t you just stop posting? You said you would before but it seems you haven’t, also i’ve only added things to points that were brought up even if they were very little.[/quote]

You really are a moron. One even including a girl? congrad-u-fucking-lations. I do professional coaching little girl. I’m payed for it. Also, your opinions are wrong. Everything i’ve said has been tested and tried. Proven successful on most occasions.

I did win. Around 4 posts ago. Yet you fail to accept it. It’s my pleasure to drum it into you. Fuckwit.

[quote=“sp11k3t3ht3rd, post:59, topic:429134”]Rather than make a new post I figure I’ll just tag on here? So I met this girl at work like around October. We actually live in the same town. We have each others numbers and text a bit. We’ve made plans to hang out before but they’ve fallen through both times because one of our other friends couldn’t go. I’ve come to like her a lot. Since I’m a junior this year I asked her to go to my prom since she doesn’t go to my school.

ME:

Hey, I know this is kinda lame doing this over txt, but I don’t get to see you that much in person. I was wondering if you wanted to go to my prom with me. Obviously you don’t have to answer now. My cousin(also friend from work) will be in the same limo so you’ll have someone to talk to besides me haha

HER:

AW lol mikee that’d be so fun! When is it??

intermittant txts about me being nervous about asking her…

HER:

Hahahahah its fine, but ill defs check it out!

It’s been like a week and we’ve been talking a bit but she hasn’t said anything. Also, like my entire family has told me that I should date her…but I don’t think I have a chance… do any of you?[/quote]

Firstly, you’ve done a great job in asking her. It’s preferable that you ask questions like that in person so you can gauge her reaction, but that will do. As for the problem of her not bringing it up, that’s an easy fix. Just ask her what the go is. I do have a few suggestions on how you’re handling this girl though:

  1. You need to actually see her a little more. True emotional bonds cannot be established through text. Ask to catch lunch. Moving in bed at yours is even better. You always always get your dick wet.

  2. You can’t rely on text. There’s a few reasons. The first is that you can’t see how she reacts to certain things said. Body language reveals more than a bunch of words. I was always told to judge a girl by her actions, not her words. It’s helped me out a fair bit. Also, by hiding behind text you gain false confidence. Sure it’s easier to hide behind a phone, but it’s never going to improve your game.

  3. This is the most important one. Families usually encourage the idea of relationships a little too much. They’re very old-school when it comes to dating. Ignore them. Most of all, ignore mum. If most people did the opposite of how much explained to get girls, then they would get girls haha! Don’t push a relationship. Especially when you barely hangout and haven’t had your prom yet.

Enjoy every interaction for what it is. Don’t bring it up, yet still show interest. If you push, she will pull back. If you’re really cool about it and patient, then she will leap at the opportunity after time. Our brains make it a bit difficult. We’re hardwired to protect what we see as valuable. Fight the urge.

Hope i’ve been some help.

Read full topic

item.title: What Should I do?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:56, topic:429134”][quote author=kickingjamie link=topic=531829.msg3888189#msg3888189 date=1326642993]

Shy people are generally very talkative when it comes to facebook/texting ect. So if she has facebook try and talk to her. Ask her about school work or something you’ve seen her doing at school. Start of small and gradually work up.

Ask her if shes ok, if she says no offer your support. If she says yes then ask her why shes so qiuet.

Generally though; just man-up and talk to her, every girl is different so talk to her and find out what she likes.

Do not do that. Odds are she has no friends, and if you ask her why she doesn’t talk, you’re asking her why she doesn’t have friends, which would probably make her more depressed. (Assuming she already is depressed).

Generally people in school/college have atleast one freind. I based my advise from that. If she says she has no freinds then you offer to be her freind… Simples.
[/quote]
And then you get into her pants after that, simple. :)[/quote]
can I get into your pants plzplzplz?

Read full topic

I'm rather experienced with the opposite sex actually. You're also not the only one who's spoken to people in these situations? What a poor argument to throw at me. I've also coached plenty of guys in these situations. Majority of them have been successful.

I'm saying even if approched correctly she still wouldn't talk about herself, waht aren't you understanding?

For her to open up at all on the first approach wouldn't be possible, she would hardly talk about anything let alone herself. She might giggle a bit if she found their conversation humourous but i'm sure she wouldn't spill her guts about her life.

Like i said above (i’ve repeated this line a thousand times, because you must have selective reading or something), I agree she wouldn’t ‘open up’ immediately on an emotional level. However, she would enjoy talking about herself if the approach is handled correctly.
